caption.center: BRADFORD v. WARDEN OF MARYLAND PENITENTIARY

opinion.syllabus:
HABEAS CORPUS — Question Presented Moot, Where PetitionerReleased After He Applied for Leave to Appeal from Denial ofWrit. In this habeas corpus proceeding petitioner filed for the writ on September 6, 1957, claiming that his sentence for a criminal offense had expired in March, 1957. The writ was denied on the same day, and a "desire" to appeal was filed on September 10, 1957. He was released from prison on September 24, 1957, and this Court, in dismissing his application for leave to appeal, on January 23, 1958, held that the question presented had become moot upon his release on September 24. It was also noted that he was now serving another sentence which was imposed after his release in September, 1957. pp. 638-639
J.E.B.Page 638 Decided January 23, 1958.
opinion.posture:
Habeas corpus proceeding by James C. Bradford against the Warden of the Maryland Penitentiary. From a refusal of the writ, petitioner applied for leave to appeal.
Application dismissed, with costs.
opinion.panel: Before BRUNE, C.J., and HENDERSON, HAMMOND, PRESCOTT and HORNEY, JJ.
opinion.opinion_byline: HORNEY, J., delivered the opinion of the Court.
